result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Michel Valdez Jara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders expungement per 973.015 following payment of the costs.  (Def to follow up with the Clerk of Court re that procedure when the time comes.)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Ricardo Michel Valdez Jara in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Status in 15CM210, 15TR2006 and 15TR2005.  DA Harper informs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to count 2/dc of 15CM210 for DRI of count 1 in that case and dismissal of the two TR matters.  Court asks if def needs interpreter.  Def states he does not; wants to proceed without. Def pleads no contest to count 2.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  costs.  Counsel have asked for expungement.  Court orders expungement per 973.015 following payment of the costs.  Def to follow up with the Clerk of Court re that procedure when the time comes.  Count 2 dismissed/read-in.  TR cases dismissed.

Defendant Ricardo Michel Valdez Jara in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CM210/adj. initial, along with intake for 15TR2005 and 15TR2006.  Atty. Angel states that the def wishes to waive reading of the complaint in 15CM210 and enter NG pleas in that case as well as the TR cases; status requested.  Court states the possible max. penalties in 15CM210.  Def pleads NG.  TR cases to track with CM case.  Atty. Angel is privately retained - represents in all three matters.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ricardo Michel Valdez Jara in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty AF appeared for State of Wisconsin.  RV missed initial appearance yesterday, thought it was today, so was held today at 1:30pm.  He did not see a copy of the complaint, so the court provided him with a copy.  Court suggests RV obtain an atty.  Adjourned initial set for 9:00am 1/20/16.
